Given the evidence that an exuberant inflammatory response contributes to the pathogenesis of severe influenza with pneumonitis and/or acute respiratory distress syndrome,
5, 81 it seems appropriate to consider using immunomodulatory agents
82 in addition to targeting viral replication. Such interventions have shown potential benefits in vitro, in observational studies or in animal models.
83, 84 Proposed approaches include the use of macrolides
85, 86 and statins
87 but the clinical benefits of immunomodulation have been hard to demonstrate.
88 Corticosteroid treatment of hospitalised patients with influenza is generally to be avoided.
